notes.title: Welcome to QuantumNotes
notes.content:
Welcome to QuantumNotes! ðŸŽ‰

This is your first note in QuantumNotes. Here are some things you can try:

  • Voice Commands: Click the voice button and say "new note" or "search notes"
  • AI Features: Select this text and right-click to try AI summarization
  • Rich Editing: Use the toolbar to format your text
  • Auto-Save: Your notes are automatically saved as you type

Getting Started

1. Create a new note using the "New Note" button
2. Try voice input for hands-free note taking
3. Use AI features to enhance your content
4. Search through your notes with natural language

Happy note-taking!

notes.title: Voice Commands Guide
notes.content:
Voice Commands Reference

Here are the voice commands you can use with QuantumNotes:

Basic Commands

  • "New note" - Create a new note
  • "Save this" - Save selected text as a note
  • "Search [query]" - Search your notes

AI Commands

  • "Summarize" - AI-summarize selected text
  • "Organize" - AI-organize selected content
  • "Translate" - Translate selected text
  • "Expand" - Expand and improve writing

Tips

â€¢ Speak clearly and at a normal pace
â€¢ Use natural language - the AI understands context
â€¢ You can combine commands like "new note about meeting tomorrow"

notes.title: AI Features Overview
notes.content:
AI-Powered Features

QuantumNotes integrates with advanced AI models to enhance your note-taking experience:

Available AI Models

  • OpenAI GPT-4o: Most advanced model for complex tasks
  • OpenAI GPT-4o Mini: Faster, more cost-effective option
  • Anthropic Claude 3.5 Sonnet: Excellent for analysis and writing
  • Anthropic Claude 3.5 Haiku: Fast and efficient for simple tasks

AI Actions

Summarize: Condense long text into key points
Organize: Structure and categorize information
Translate: Convert text to different languages
Expand: Add detail and context to brief notes
Improve: Enhance writing quality and clarity

Usage Tips

â€¢ Select text before using AI features
â€¢ Different models work better for different tasks
â€¢ AI responses are saved as new notes for easy reference
